ground_truth: Juno, wearing the adapted jeans, comes down the school with her hands long in the pockets of her baggy tartan parker as her fellow students, staring at her belly, clear a path to let her pass. Mark is at home composing. In the school canteen, the two girls eat their lunch in an empty school awards booth while Leah gazes adoringly at the tubby bearded teacher. At his locker, Bleeker knocks back as Juno waddles up to him and looks him straight in the eye. Bleeker's eye shift as he glances in Katrina's direction, and his head drops miserably. Juno strides away with her canvas bag over her shoulder, leaving Bleeker standing by his locker, watching her glumly. Juno hoists herself up into her dad's Previa, puts on some lip balm, and starts the engine. Meanwhile, Mark, surfing on his PC, sees the blue van pull up outside as Juno follows him downstairs, and he leads her into a cluttered basement room. She reads a title and her hands grab his waist. He brings the up to his neck, and with his hands round her waist, her belly touching his, she closes her eyes and rests her head on his chest as they slowly sway together. Mark, with his chin brushing against her hair, seems unsettled as Juno looks up startled and stares at him in bewilderment. Vanessa, loaded down with shopping, comes into her pristine white kitchen while Mark lowers his gaze. Juno starts to go and bolts out of the door, clutching her belly as she waddles out to the Previa. Mark, in his rock T-shirt over a long-sleeved undershirt, looks coldly at Vanessa and goes back to his room, and Vanessa sinks down on the stairs and gazes unhappily into space. Beneath a cloudy sky, Juno drives under a road bridge, passing a freight train on one side. She pulls off the main carriageway onto the soft shoulder, next to a sward of dull green grass dotted with patches of spring snow, runs her hand over her own belly as she gives into tears, and crammed in behind the wheel, seems oblivious of the passing cars as she rubs her belly under her thick tartan coat, her eyes staring straight ahead, not looking at anything in particular, and she starts to calm down. The car lights flash, and she pulls back onto the road and drives off. Up in his room, Bleeker is playing his guitar after dark. On the bonnet of the van, with her head resting on the sloping front windscreen and her hands tucked behind her back, Juno stares up at the sky. She suddenly raises herself onto her elbows, climbs back into the van, rummages behind her to find a crumpled receipt, smoothes it out on the steering wheel of the van, and starts to write on it.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: Juno, wearing the modified jeans, descends the school with her hands deep in the pockets of her loose tartan parka as her fellow students, staring at her abdomen, clear a path to let her proceed. Mark is at home creating. In the school cafeteria, the two girls consume their lunch in an empty school awards booth while Leah gazes admiringly at the chubby bearded instructor. At his locker, Bleeker leans back as Juno waddles up to him and looks him straight in the eye. Bleeker's eyes shift as he glances in Katrina's direction, and his head drops dejectedly. Juno strides away with her canvas bag over her shoulder, leaving Bleeker standing by his locker, observing her dismally. Juno hoists herself up into her dad's Previa, applies some lip balm, and starts the engine. Meanwhile, Mark, browsing on his PC, notices the blue van pull up outside as Juno follows him downstairs, and he leads her into a cluttered basement room. She reads a headline and her hands seize his waist. He brings them up to his neck, and with his hands around her waist, her abdomen touching his, she closes her eyes and rests her head on his chest as they slowly sway together. Mark, with his chin brushing against her hair, seems unsettled as Juno looks up startled and stares at him in confusion. Vanessa, loaded down with purchases, enters her immaculate white kitchen while Mark lowers his gaze. Juno starts to leave and bolts out of the door, clutching her abdomen as she waddles out to the Previa. Mark, in his rock T-shirt over a long-sleeved undershirt, looks coldly at Vanessa and returns to his room, and Vanessa sinks down on the stairs and gazes unhappily into space. Beneath a cloudy sky, Juno drives under a road bridge, passing a freight train on one side. She pulls off the main road onto the soft shoulder, next to a sward of dull green grass dotted with patches of spring snow, runs her hand over her own abdomen as she gives into tears, and crammed in behind the wheel, seems oblivious to the passing cars as she rubs her abdomen under her thick tartan coat, her eyes staring straight ahead, not looking at anything in particular, and she starts to calm down. The car lights flash, and she pulls back onto the road and drives off. Up in his room, Bleeker is playing his guitar after dark. On the hood of the van, with her head resting on the sloping front windscreen and her hands tucked behind her back, Juno stares up at the sky. She suddenly raises herself onto her elbows, climbs back into the van, searches behind her to find a crumpled receipt, smoothes it out on the steering wheel of the van, and starts to write on it.

Home compositions are being created by Mark. In the school canteen, their lunch is eaten by the two girls in an empty school awards booth while Leah adoringly gazes at the tubby bearded teacher. Meanwhile, the blue van is seen pulling up outside on his PC by Mark, as she follows him downstairs, and he leads her into a cluttered basement room. A title is read by her, and his waist is grabbed by her hands. The hands are brought up to his neck by him, and with his hands round her waist, her belly touching his, her eyes are closed, and she rests her head on his chest as they sway together slowly. Juno is looked at up startled and is stared at in bewilderment by Mark, with his chin brushing against her hair, who seems unsettled. Juno starts to go and bolts out of the door, her belly is clutched as she waddles out to the Previa. Vanessa is looked at coldly by Mark, in his rock T-shirt over a long-sleeved undershirt, and he goes back to his room, while the stairs are sunk down on by Vanessa who gazes unhappily into space. Beneath a cloudy sky, under a road bridge, Juno is driven as a freight train is passed on one side. The main carriageway is pulled off by her onto the soft shoulder, next to a sward of dull green grass dotted with patches of spring snow, her hand is run over her own belly as she gives into tears, and crammed in behind the wheel, she seems oblivious of the passing cars as her belly is rubbed under her thick tartan coat, her eyes staring straight ahead, not looking at anything in particular, and she starts to calm down. The car lights are flashed, and the road is pulled back onto by her and she drives off. After dark, his guitar is played by Bleeker up in his room. On the bonnet of the van, with her head resting on the sloping front windscreen and her hands tucked behind her back, the sky is stared up at by Juno. Suddenly she raises herself onto her elbows, climbs back into the van, rummages behind her to find a crumpled receipt, smoothes it out on the steering wheel of the van, and starts to write on it.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Juno, in adapted jeans, walks through school with her hands deep in her baggy tartan parka pockets as students clear a path, staring at her belly. Mark is at home composing. In the canteen, two girls eat lunch in an empty awards booth while Leah admires a tubby bearded teacher. At his locker, Bleeker looks away as Juno approaches, then drops his head miserably. Juno leaves with her canvas bag, and Bleeker watches her glumly. Juno climbs into her dad's Previa, applies lip balm, and starts the engine. Meanwhile, Mark sees the blue van outside and leads Juno to a cluttered basement. She reads a title, grabs his waist, and they sway together, her belly touching his. Mark seems unsettled as Juno looks up, bewildered. Vanessa enters her pristine kitchen with shopping as Mark lowers his gaze. Juno bolts out, clutching her belly, and drives off in the Previa. Mark, in a rock T-shirt, looks coldly at Vanessa, who sinks onto the stairs, gazing unhappily. Under a cloudy sky, Juno drives past a freight train, pulls onto the shoulder, and, oblivious to passing cars, rubs her belly under her coat, calming down. The car lights flash, and she drives off. Bleeker plays guitar after dark. On the van's bonnet, Juno stares at the sky, then climbs back in, finds a crumpled receipt, smoothes it on the steering wheel, and starts writing.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Juno, in adapted jeans and a baggy tartan parka, walks through school as students clear a path, staring at her belly. Mark is composing at home. In the canteen, two girls eat lunch while Leah admires a bearded teacher. At his locker, Bleeker looks at Juno, then glances at Katrina, dropping his head. Juno leaves with her canvas bag, and Bleeker watches her sadly. Juno gets into her dad's Previa, applies lip balm, and starts the engine. Mark sees her arrive and leads her to a cluttered basement. They sway together, but Mark seems unsettled. Vanessa enters the kitchen with shopping as Juno leaves, clutching her belly. Mark returns to his room, and Vanessa sits on the stairs, unhappy. Juno drives under a bridge, pulls off the road, and cries, rubbing her belly. She calms down, rejoins the road, and drives off. Bleeker plays guitar in his room. Juno lies on the van's bonnet, then writes on a crumpled receipt inside.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
Juno, dressed in her uniquely styled adapted jeans, makes her way down the bustling school corridor with her hands deeply buried in the pockets of her oversized, baggy tartan parker. As she moves forward, her fellow students, their eyes fixated on her noticeably protruding belly, instinctively clear a path, allowing her to pass through without obstruction. Meanwhile, Mark is at home, fully immersed in the creative process of composing music. In the school canteen, two girls sit together, enjoying their lunch in the solitude of an empty school awards booth, while Leah gazes with admiration at the tubby, bearded teacher nearby. At his locker, Bleeker is taken aback as Juno approaches him with a determined waddle, meeting his gaze directly. Bleeker's eyes shift uneasily as he glances over in Katrina's direction, and his head drops in a gesture of misery. Juno, with her canvas bag slung over her shoulder, strides away confidently, leaving Bleeker standing by his locker, watching her departure with a sense of gloom. 

Juno then hoists herself up into her dad's Previa, applies some lip balm with care, and starts the engine. Meanwhile, Mark, while surfing on his PC, notices the familiar blue van pulling up outside. Juno follows him downstairs, and he leads her into a cluttered basement room filled with various items. She reads a title and instinctively places her hands on his waist. He gently brings them up to his neck, and with his hands encircling her waist, her belly pressing against his, she closes her eyes and rests her head on his chest as they sway together slowly. Mark, with his chin lightly brushing against her hair, appears unsettled as Juno looks up, startled, and stares at him in bewilderment. Vanessa, burdened with shopping bags, enters her immaculate white kitchen just as Mark lowers his gaze. Juno begins to leave, bolting out of the door, clutching her belly protectively as she waddles out to the Previa. Mark, wearing a rock T-shirt over a long-sleeved undershirt, casts a cold look at Vanessa before retreating back to his room, while Vanessa sinks down on the stairs, gazing unhappily into the void of space.

Beneath a sky filled with clouds, Juno drives under a road bridge, passing a freight train that rumbles along on one side. She veers off the main carriageway onto the soft shoulder, coming to a stop next to a sward of dull green grass dotted with patches of lingering spring snow. She runs her hand over her own belly as she succumbs to tears, and crammed in behind the wheel, she seems oblivious to the passing cars as she rubs her belly beneath her thick tartan coat, her eyes staring straight ahead, unfocused on anything in particular, and she gradually begins to calm down. The car lights flash, signaling her to pull back onto the road, and she drives off. Later, up in his room, Bleeker is playing his guitar in the darkness of night. On the bonnet of the van, with her head resting on the sloping front windscreen and her hands tucked behind her back, Juno gazes up at the expansive sky. Suddenly, she raises herself onto her elbows, climbs back into the van, and rummages behind her to find a crumpled receipt. She smoothes it out on the steering wheel of the van and begins to write on it, her thoughts pouring onto the paper.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
Juno, dressed in her uniquely styled and creatively designed adapted jeans, confidently makes her way down the bustling, crowded school corridor, her hands deeply and securely buried in the protective pockets of her oversized, baggy tartan parker. As she moves forward, her fellow students, with their eyes intently fixated on her noticeably protruding belly, instinctively and almost automatically clear a path, allowing her to pass through without any obstruction. Meanwhile, Mark is at home, fully engrossed and deeply immersed in the creative process of composing music. Over in the school canteen, two girls sit together, enjoying and savoring their lunch in the solitude of an otherwise empty school awards booth, while Leah gazes with admiration and interest at the tubby, bearded teacher nearby. At his locker, Bleeker is taken aback as Juno approaches him with a determined and purposeful waddle, meeting his gaze directly and unwaveringly. Bleeker's eyes shift uneasily as he cautiously glances over in Katrina's direction, and his head drops in a gesture of pure misery. Juno, with her canvas bag slung casually over her shoulder, strides away with confidence, leaving Bleeker standing by his locker, watching her departure with a sense of gloom and despondency.

Juno then hoists herself up into her dad's Previa, carefully and meticulously applies some lip balm with care, and starts the engine with determination. Meanwhile, Mark, while leisurely surfing on his PC, notices the familiar and recognizable blue van pulling up outside. Juno follows him downstairs, and he leads her into a cluttered basement room filled with various assorted items. She reads a title and instinctively places her hands gently on his waist. He gently brings them up to his neck, and with his hands tenderly encircling her waist, her belly pressing against his, she closes her eyes and rests her head on his chest as they sway together slowly. Mark, with his chin lightly and softly brushing against her hair, appears unsettled and uneasy as Juno looks up, startled, and stares at him in bewilderment and confusion. Vanessa, burdened with shopping bags, enters her immaculate white kitchen just as Mark lowers his gaze. Juno begins to leave, bolting hurriedly out of the door, clutching her belly protectively as she waddles out to the Previa. Mark, wearing a rock T-shirt over a long-sleeved undershirt, casts a cold, disinterested look at Vanessa before retreating back to his room, while Vanessa sinks down on the stairs, gazing unhappily into the void of space, lost in thought.

Beneath a sky filled with clouds, Juno drives under a road bridge, passing a freight train that rumbles along noisily on one side. She veers off the main carriageway onto the soft shoulder, coming to a stop next to a sward of dull green grass dotted with patches of lingering spring snow. She runs her hand gently over her own belly as she succumbs to tears, and crammed in behind the wheel, she seems oblivious to the passing cars as she rubs her belly beneath her thick tartan coat, her eyes staring straight ahead, unfocused on anything in particular, and she gradually begins to calm down. The car lights flash insistently, signaling her to pull back onto the road, and she drives off. Later, up in his room, Bleeker is playing his guitar in the darkness of the quiet night. On the bonnet of the van, with her head resting on the sloping front windscreen and her hands tucked securely behind her back, Juno gazes thoughtfully up at the expansive sky. Suddenly, she raises herself onto her elbows, climbs back into the van, and rummages behind her to find a crumpled receipt. She smoothes it out carefully on the steering wheel of the van and begins to write on it, her thoughts pouring onto the paper in a steady stream.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Juno, wearing adapted jeans and a baggy tartan parka, walks through school as her fellow students clear a path, staring at her belly. Meanwhile, Mark is at home composing. In the school canteen, Juno and Leah eat lunch in an empty awards booth while Leah admires a teacher. At his locker, Bleeker looks dejected as Juno approaches, meets his gaze, and then walks away, leaving him watching her glumly. Juno gets into her dad's Previa, applies lip balm, and starts the engine. Mark, surfing on his PC, notices the blue van outside as Juno follows him to a cluttered basement room. They sway together, her head on his chest, but Mark seems unsettled when Juno looks up at him in bewilderment. Vanessa enters her kitchen with shopping as Mark lowers his gaze and returns to his room, leaving Vanessa to sit on the stairs, gazing unhappily. Under a cloudy sky, Juno drives past a freight train, pulls onto the shoulder, and, overwhelmed with emotion, rubs her belly and calms down. She then drives off. Later, Bleeker plays guitar in his room after dark. Juno, lying on the van's bonnet, stares at the sky, then climbs back inside, finds a crumpled receipt, smoothes it out, and starts writing on it.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Juno, wearing the adapted jeansâ€”tailored specially to accommodate her growing pregnancyâ€”comes down the school hallway with her hands long in the pockets of her baggy tartan parker, which recalls the punk fashion of the 1970s, as her fellow students, staring at her belly, clear a path to let her pass. Mark is at home composing music, likely working on one of his garage band songs that he hopes will help him escape his mundane life. In the school canteen, the two girls eat their lunch in an empty school awards booth, dusty and filled with trophies from past sports victories, while Leah gazes adoringly at the tubby bearded teacher who is known for his engaging history lessons. At his locker, Bleeker, wearing his cross-country team jersey symbolizing his passion for running, knocks back as Juno waddles up to him and looks him straight in the eye. Bleeker's eyes shift as he glances in Katrina's direction, who is known for her competitive cheerleading prowess, and his head drops miserably. Juno strides away with her canvas bag over her shoulder, a bag covered in patches from various bands, leaving Bleeker standing by his locker, watching her glumly. Juno hoists herself up into her dad's Previa, a reliable old minivan known for its spacious interior, puts on some cherry-flavored lip balm, and starts the engine. Meanwhile, Mark, surfing on his PC, sees the blue van pull up outside as Juno follows him downstairs, and he leads her into a cluttered basement room, filled with the paraphernalia of his music hobby. She reads a title, perhaps of a classic rock song they both adore, and her hands grab his waist. He brings them up to his neck, and with his hands round her waist, her belly touching his, she closes her eyes and rests her head on his chest as they slowly sway together. Mark, with his chin brushing against her hair, seems unsettled as Juno looks up startled and stares at him in bewilderment. Vanessa, loaded down with shopping from the upscale organic grocery store nearby, comes into her pristine white kitchen while Mark lowers his gaze. Juno starts to go and bolts out of the door, clutching her belly as she waddles out to the Previa. Mark, in his rock T-shirt over a long-sleeved undershirtâ€”a style reminiscent of grunge musicâ€”looks coldly at Vanessa and goes back to his room, and Vanessa sinks down on the stairs and gazes unhappily into space. Beneath a cloudy sky, Juno drives under a road bridge, a common passage for commuters, passing a freight train on one side. She pulls off the main carriageway onto the soft shoulder, next to a sward of dull green grass dotted with patches of spring snow, runs her hand over her own belly as she gives into tears, and crammed in behind the wheel, seems oblivious of the passing cars as she rubs her belly under her thick tartan coat, her eyes staring straight ahead, not looking at anything in particular, and she starts to calm down. The car lights flash, reminding her of the many late-night drives she's taken to clear her head, and she pulls back onto the road and drives off. Up in his room, Bleeker is playing his guitar after dark, strumming the chords of a song he wrote. On the bonnet of the van, with her head resting on the sloping front windscreen and her hands tucked behind her back, Juno stares up at the sky scattered with stars. She suddenly raises herself onto her elbows, climbs back into the van, rummages behind her to find a crumpled receipt from the local diner where she often goes for fries, smoothes it out on the steering wheel of the van, and starts to write on it.

In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Vanessa loaded down with shopping comes into her pristine white kitchen while Mark lowers his gaze. Juno starts to go and bolts out of the door clutching her belly as she waddles out to the Previa. Mark in his rock Tshirt over a longsleeved undershirt looks coldly at Vanessa and goes back to his room and Vanessa sinks down on the stairs and gazes unhappily into space. Beneath a cloudy sky Juno drives under a road bridge passing a freight train on one side. She pulls off the main carriageway onto the soft shoulder next to a sward of dull green grass dotted with patches of spring. snow runs her hand over her own belly as she gives into tears and crammed in behind the wheel seems oblivious of the passing cars as she rubs her belly under her thick tartan coat her eyes staring straight ahead not looking at anything in particular and she starts to calm down. The car lights flash and she pulls back onto the road and drives off. Up in his room. Bleeker is playing his guitar after dark. On the bonnet of the van with her head resting on the sloping front windscreen and her hands tucked behind her back. Juno stares up at the sky. She suddenly raises herself onto her elbows climbs back into the van rummages behind her to find a crumpled receipt smoothes it out on the steering wheel of the van and starts to write on it.

test_cases.name: Deletion (~50%)
test_cases.description: Juno wearing the adapted jeans comes down the school with her hands long in the pockets of her baggy tartan parker as her fellow students staring at her belly clear a path to let her pass. Mark is at home composing. In the school canteen the two girls eat their lunch in an empty school awards booth while Leah gazes adoringly at the tubby bearded teacher. At his locker Bleeker knocks back as Juno waddles up to him and looks him straight in the eye. Bleeker's eye shift as he glances in Katrina's direction and his head drops miserably. Juno strides away with her canvas bag over her shoulder leaving Bleeker standing by his locker watching her glumly. The car lights flash and she pulls back onto the road and drives off. Up in his room. Bleeker is playing his guitar after dark. On the bonnet of the van with her head resting on the sloping front windscreen and her hands tucked behind her back. Juno stares up at the sky. She suddenly raises herself onto her elbows climbs back into the van rummages behind her to find a crumpled receipt smoothes it out on the steering wheel of the van and starts to write on it.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Luna, donning the mismatched sneakers, floats up the mountain with her elbows tucked in the sleeves of her oversized striped cape as her fellow hikers, glancing at her backpack, part the trail to let her ascend. Tom is at the cabin painting. In the mountain lodge, the two rabbits snack on their berries in an abandoned mountaintop cabin while Lucy gawks lovingly at the pudgy horned guide. At the trailhead, Buster trips forward as Luna bounces over to him and glances him directly in the tooth. Buster's tooth shifts as he peeks in Frida's direction, and his knees slump joylessly. Luna glides away with her rucksack slung across her torso, leaving Buster leaning against the trailhead, observing her drearily. Luna hauls herself onto her uncle's scooter, applies some sunscreen, and revs the engine. Meanwhile, Tom, sketching on his tablet, spots the red scooter park outside as Luna trails him upslope, and he directs her into a crowded treehouse. She scans a label and her fingers clasp his wrist. He draws them to his chin, and with his arms encircling her shoulders, her backpack pressing his, she closes her ears and rests her foot on his knee as they slowly rock together. Tom, with his nose grazing against her hood, seems perturbed as Luna peers up confused and gapes at him in puzzlement. Valerie, weighed down with gear, enters her spotless black conservatory while Tom averts his gaze. Luna starts to dash and sprints out of the door, gripping her backpack as she bounces out to the scooter. Tom, in his sport jersey under a wooly vest, glances bitterly at Valerie and retreats to his den, and Valerie sinks onto the couch and stares despondently into the void. Beneath a dim sky, Luna maneuvers under an old tunnel, bypassing a cargo ship on one side. She swerves off the main trail onto the rough shoulder, beside a field of faded yellow weeds speckled with flakes of winter frost, runs her foot over her own backpack as she gives in to sobs, and wedged in behind the handlebars, seems oblivious to the wandering owls as she pats her backpack under her thick striped cloak, her gaze fixed directly forward, not focusing on anything in sight, and she starts to settle down. The scooter horn echoes, and she merges back onto the trail and speeds away. Up in his attic, Buster is plucking his banjo after dusk. On the hood of the scooter, with her knee resting on the angled rear window and her arms crossed behind her neck, Luna gazes up at the clouds. She abruptly lifts herself onto her heels, hops back onto the scooter, searches behind her to find a wrinkled flyer, flattens it on the handlebars of the scooter, and begins to scribble on it.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby cafÃ©, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Juno walks through school, wearing adapted jeans and a tartan parker, as classmates stare at her pregnant belly. Bleeker is at his locker, showing disappointment as Juno approaches and then leaves him behind. Meanwhile, Mark is at home, composing on his computer. Juno meets Mark in his cluttered basement, and they sway together, causing Juno confusion as Mark seems unsettled. Vanessa arrives home carrying groceries, and Mark returns to his room, leaving Vanessa dejected. Juno leaves to her dad's van, overwhelmed, she pulls over and cries, soothing her belly. She eventually calms down, resumes driving, and later, Juno writes on a crumpled receipt, staring at the sky. Bleeker plays guitar in his room, lost in thought.
